title: Chapter 570
content:
Shin Youngwoo's mind raced, his gaze fixed on the broadcast.

*Will Belial have a weakness, just like Hell Gao and the fire stones?*

Hell was a great demon's domain—their true home. Exerting full strength in the human world should be impossible. Hell Gao had proven that precedent. Belial must face similar limitations.

*I need to find her weakness.*

All he could do was watch as the Overgeared members clashed with Belial. Youngwoo forced himself to accept this role rather than agonize over his absence from the battlefield. He steadied his breathing and studied Belial with clinical precision—her skills, her movements, the cadence of her voice, the subtle shifts in her expression, the focus of her eyes.

It was the right decision. Every fragment of Grid's growth fed Shin Youngwoo's understanding.

Meanwhile, Sehee sat beside her brother, cheeks flushed. How long had it been since they'd sat together like this? A childhood memory surfaced, warm and nostalgic. But the moment shattered almost instantly. Her eyes widened, and her lips pressed into a thin, disapproving line.

The great demon on the television was *practically naked*. Flames only covered the most essential parts! This content should be rated for mature audiences!

"Are you okay?"

"Huh?"

Youngwoo blinked as his sister's glare bore into him. Being an older brother was truly an impossible task.

***

A king's first duty: protect the people. This principle formed the bedrock of the bond between ruler and subject. King Aslan had shattered that principle. He'd sacrificed his people to summon a great demon. He'd abdicated the king's authority by his own hand. The act would echo through West Continent history as an unfathomable atrocity.

"The king killed my daughter!"

"The king killed my sister!"

"The king killed my friend!"

"The king murdered them!"

"Aslan is no king!"

Beyond the palace walls, the people's rage erupted in curses and accusations. Smoke choked the skies above Reinhardt—the remnants of 9,999 innocent virgins burned at the stake.

King Aslan didn't spare a thought for the angry, grieving, wailing masses. Their curses entered one ear and exited the other. In his twisted mind, enduring complaints was preferable to watching the kingdom crumble.

*The people of a small kingdom are different from the people of the continent's finest power. My resolve today will pave the way to future splendor for all of you... You'll understand someday.*

King Aslan rationalized his atrocity, justifying the demon's summoning. Then he witnessed the colossal mortar descending from the heavens.

**KRAKOOM!**

"Heok...!"

Divine punishment? The guilt buried in his heart's depths surged forth, and King Aslan collapsed.

"...Your Majesty!"

"Your Majesty! Please wake up!"

"Your Majesty!"

"..."

A familiar voice pulled him back. King Aslan's glazed eyes fluttered open, relief washing over his features. If he was seeing Chucksley, then surely he wasn't in hell.

"You're alive... What was that mortar that fell from the sky?"

Chucksley's expression was grim as he explained. "It was a technique deployed by an Overgeared member. One of the great demon's arms was destroyed."

"*What?*"

The strongest monarch of hell—fatally wounded? No, wait. Belial wasn't the strongest. She was the 32nd great demon. Anxiety clawed at King Aslan as he scrambled to the window. Had Belial perished before granting his wish?

**BOOM! CRASH! BOOM!**

**RUMBLE!**

Pandemonium sprawled beyond the palace. Ruins stretched across Reinhardt. Overgeared members burned in Belial's flames. No—this was no balanced battle. Belial was slaughtering them.

"Ha! Hahaha! That's right! A great demon wouldn't fall so easily!"

*Yes, Belial. Don't forget why you were summoned. Defend the kingdom and annihilate the invaders! Make Eternal the most powerful kingdom on the continent!*

Madness blazed in King Aslan's eyes as he cheered for the great demon. Chucksley recoiled at the sight.

*The king has changed.*

He'd never been qualified from the beginning. There had been some reason, once—some cause. King Aslan's sin was unforgivable, but at least he'd been minimally competent as a ruler. Not anymore. King Aslan was descending into insanity.

*...The end.*

Chucksley realized the kingdom his ancestors had bled and suffered for was facing its final chapter.

***

"Sky Dragon's Tears!"

**RUMBLE!**

They had to hold until Kraugel arrived. Lauel rescinded the retreat order and fought alongside Piaro, Isabel, Maxong, and the other Overgeared members. Only the soldiers withdrew. The Flow Master's ultimate weather manipulation technique filled the sky with thunder and rain, dampening Belial's flames.

"Free Farming 4th Style, Plowing the Field!"

**RUMBLE!**

Piaro's pitchfork carved through the scorched earth. Magnificent. He resembled a god of agriculture. The ground Belial trampled transformed into farmland in an instant.

"Are you *mocking* me?"

Clearing fields during battle? Even Belial—one of hell's 33 great demons—couldn't remain composed. She ridiculed Piaro as flames erupted around her. Isabel intercepted the attack, shielding Piaro's technique.

"Rebecca's servant! You're *pathetic!*"

Belial loathed Rebecca, the goddess of light—their natures were opposites. Her flames collided with Lifael's Spear as she lunged forward, seizing Isabel's throat.

"*Kuock!*"

Isabel's exhaustion from prolonged combat left her vulnerable. Belial grabbed her and slammed her face into the ground. Fortunately, Piaro's cleared land was soft rather than firm. Dirt smeared Isabel's face, but she suffered no serious injury.

"Isabel!"

Damian rushed to heal her. Isabel staggered upright, but Belial had already dismissed her. She crossed the newly-formed rice field, closing in on Piaro.

"*Cough!*"

Piaro's face tightened as he continued sowing seeds. She'd been a hundred meters away—now her movement speed was terrifying. Panic flickered through Piaro when a black shadow intervened. Faker.

**CLANG!**

He couldn't strike Belial, but he could intercept her assault. He crossed his daggers, blocking Belial's thrust. The dagger meant for murder became a shield for protection.

> **[Your perfect defense has failed.]**
> **[You have suffered 9,830 damage.]**
> **[The distance with Belial is too close! You will receive 500 heat damage and 2,500 burn damage!]**

"*Kuk!*"

Faker trembled. A monster like this existed in the world? His eyes wavered as he glared at Belial.

*An ordinary human responded to my attack?*

Indeed. Faker's swiftness and control impressed even a great demon. However, the significance was limited. In the future—after reaching his fourth or fifth advancement—Faker might threaten a great demon. But currently, he'd only completed his third class advancement.

**WHOOSH!**

Flames erupted from Belial's palms and pierced Faker's chest, disintegrating him into grey light.

"Faker!"

The man who'd annihilated the Ice Flower Guild—killed in an instant? Lauel, the Overgeared members, and viewers worldwide reeled in shock.

"Free Farming 1st Style, Sowing!"

**Pop! Pop-pop-pop-pop!**

Faker's sacrifice bought Piaro the time to plant countless seeds.

"This ends *now!*"

This fool kept tending fields—was he mocking a great demon? Belial's irritation flared at the man who'd severed her arm and disrupted her focus. She surged past the dying Faker, attacking Piaro. Her flaming limbs struck like lightning bolts.

But the Overgeared members hadn't squandered Faker's sacrifice. Several members formed a human wall before Belial—a barrier to protect Piaro. This was the Overgeared members' role in battle.

"*Kuaaaack!*"

Ten Overgeared members perished from Belial's onslaught.

"Free Farming 2nd Style, Rapid Growth!"

Fury burned in Piaro's eyes as he blessed the planted seeds.

**CRACK-CRACK-CRACK!**

Hundreds of seeds sprouted instantly, surging into massive trees. Not ordinary trees—ancient, beautiful giants that seemed to have lived for centuries. They formed a natural prison, caging Belial.

*Instantly raising trees?*

Even the elves couldn't accomplish this. Belial admitted a grudging respect—but the result was futile. She was the queen of fire! Piaro was a fool to trap her in wood.

"It's enough if I *burn* it!"

**WHOOSH!**

Belial detonated her flames to reduce the trees to ash. However, Maxong moved faster.

"Your rampage ends here!"

As the Water Clan King, Maxong was a master of water magic. He cast his spell.

**WHOOSH!**

Like an ascending blue dragon, water surged from the ground beneath Belial, trapping her inside.

> **[The flames surrounding the 32nd Great Demon Belial have temporarily vanished!]**
> **[You are free from the terrible heat!]**

Maxong—king of his species. Now that he'd overcome the grief of losing his daughter, he was a powerhouse rivaling Piaro. Granted, his full strength manifested only in the sea. Still, he displayed formidable power.

"Now, Piaro!"

"Yes!"

Belial writhed within the water pillar.

"Fated to Perish."

Piaro seized the opening and deployed his most devastating single-target skill. His hand plow pierced Belial's forehead.

**THUNK!**

"...!"

Fated to Perish—an absolutely invincible technique with a 100% instant-kill rate. Naturally, targets classified as bosses resisted instant death. However, critical damage still occurred.

"*Kuk...! Kuaaaaaaaack!*"

Belial couldn't endure the agony, releasing a terrible scream. A reaction far more visceral than when she'd lost her arm.

**『 ... 』**

**—...**

Commentators and viewers worldwide fell silent.

A great demon. The raid against the worst and strongest boss...

**—This is an agricultural promotional video.**

**—Farming is truly magnificent.**

**—Let's all wield hand plows.**

Piaro seemed to proclaim exactly that. Many watching the raid footage developed newfound interest in the farmer class. This was the strength of a legend. Piaro, who pioneered the path of a new legend through sheer power alone. Piaro was extraordinary.

S.A. Group Chairman Lim Cheolho paid direct attention to him.

"To me...! *Wounding me twice!*"

Belial clutched her forehead where Piaro's hand plow struck and fired demonic energy in all directions. She shattered the water pillar and trees restraining her, breaking free. She finally recognized Piaro's true nature.

"Now I understand. You're a *legend?*"

Sword Saint Muller. A transcendent existence who'd humiliated several great demons centuries ago.

"You're Muller's reincarnation!"

"No. I'm a farmer, not Muller."

"*Shut up!*"

She knew legends existed in the human world, but never a farmer among them. He couldn't be a farmer.

"Stop *mocking* me!"

"..."

No more carelessness. She would unleash her full power! Belial turned serious, revealing her true strength.

"Summoning the 32nd Hell!"

**CRACKLE!**

**CRACK-CRACK-CRACK!**

The landscape behind Belial split apart. Endless darkness poured from the fracture.

"I will tear you to *shreds!*"

Satisfaction curved Belial's lips.

**FLASH!**

Darkness consumed the world.

> **[The 32nd Hell has been summoned!]**
> **[Skill and magic power is reduced by 20% and casting speed is reduced by 50%.]**
> **[Health and mana won't recover.]**
> **[Stamina will fall faster.]**
> **[Potions can't be used.]**
> **[Creatures of the 32nd Hell will emerge!]**

"Ah..."

Hope drained from the Overgeared members. Piaro's expression hardened. Hundreds of beautiful purple-skinned succubuses soared through the air.

**『 This is impossible... 』**

**『 A great demon that renders even the Overgeared Guild helpless... How can anyone defeat it? Now the continent will descend into chaos, and gameplay will be severely restricted. 』**

**『 There's no hope unless the Saharan Empire deploys forces at scale. 』**

The global atmosphere plummeted. Fear of the future the great demon would bring gripped countless viewers. Then a sword fell from the heavens. The succubuses attacking Overgeared members sustained wounds.

"I apologize for the delay."

The sky above the sky. Sword Saint Kraugel had arrived.
